name: buzzer.playNotes
content:
Plays an array of notes one after the other.

[`buzzer.playNotes()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.playNotes/) is a method of the buzzer that plays an array of notes one after the other at a given tempo. All of the notes are played as a whole note; if you want to change how long a particular note is played for, you can use the [`buzzer.playSong()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.playSong/) method.

This method accepts two parameters: a one-dimensional array full of notes, and a tempo to play them at. Tempo is an optional parameter, but if left undefined defaults to 120bpm.

palette_params.name: notes
palette_params.description: An array of notes (such as `['C4', 'D4', 'E4']`). Each note will be played in sequence from first (index 0) to last (index `notes.length - 1`).

palette_params.name: tempo
palette_params.description: The tempo determines the speed at which the list of notes will be played, in beats per minute (or bpm). If a tempo is not included, notes will play at a default tempo of 120 bpm

short_description: Plays an array of notes one after the other.
tips: * To add a pause in between notes, add a new item that contains `null`. `null` is a way to represent emptiness in computer science, and the [`buzzer.playNotes()`(#f78183)](/docs/applab/buzzer.playNotes/) method will read that as "Play nothing for the duration of a whole note".
